'Military technology' is the collection of equipment, vehicles, structures and
communication systems that are designed for use in warfare. It comprises the
kinds of technology that are distinctly military in nature and not civilian in
application, usually because they are impractical in civilian application,
have no legal civilian usage, or are dangerous to use without appropriate
military training.

It is common for military technology to have been researched and developed by
scientists and engineers specifically for use in battle by the armed forces.
Many new technologies came as a result of the military funding of science.
'Weapons engineering' is the design, development, testing and lifecycle
management of military weapons and systems. It draws on the knowledge of several
traditional engineering disciplines, including mechanical engineering,
electrical engineering, mechatronics, electro-optics, aerospace engineering,
materials engineering, and chemical engineering.

There are a significant number of military inventions that are technologies
originally developed and designed for military purposes, and which are now used
by civilians with sometimes minor or no modifications at all.
